`,(0,i.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,i.jsx)(n.code,{className:"language-cpp",children:`#include <iostream>\r
#include <vector>\r
using namespace std;\r
\r
int N, K, W, V;\r
vector<vector<int> > dp;\r
// dp[\uAC2F\uC218][\uBB34\uAC8C]\r
// dp[N][K]\r
\r
int main()\r
{\r
	ios::sync_with_stdio(false);\r
	cin.tie(0);\r
	cout.tie(0);\r
\r
	cin >> N >> K;\r
	dp.resize(N + 1, vector<int>(K + 1, 0));\r
\r
	for (int i = 1; i <= N; i++)\r
	{\r
		cin >> W >> V;\r
\r
		for (int j = 1; j <= K; j++)\r
		{\r
			dp[i][j] = dp[i - 1][j];\r
			if (W <= j)\r
				dp[i][j] = max(dp[i][j], dp[i - 1][j - W] + V);\r
		}\r
	}\r
\r
	cout << dp[N][K];\r
\r
	return 0;\r
}

`,(0,e.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{className:"language-cpp",children:`#include <iostream>\r
#include <vector>\r
using namespace std;\r
\r
int N, M, m[101], c;\r
vector<vector<int> > dp;\r
\r
int main()\r
{\r
	ios::sync_with_stdio(false);\r
	cin.tie(0);\r
	cout.tie(0);\r
\r
	cin >> N >> M;\r
	for (int i = 1; i <= N; i++)\r
		cin >> m[i];\r
	dp.resize(N + 1, vector<int>(10001, 0));\r
\r
	for (int i = 1; i <= N; i++)\r
	{\r
		cin >> c;\r
\r
		for (int j = 0; j <= 10000; j++)\r
		{\r
			dp[i][j] = dp[i - 1][j];\r
			if (j >= c)\r
				dp[i][j] = max(dp[i][j], dp[i - 1][j - c] + m[i]);\r
		}\r
	}\r
\r
	for (int j = 0; j <= 10000; j++)\r
	{\r
		if (dp[N][j] >= M)\r
		{\r
			cout << j;\r
			return 0;\r
		}\r
	}\r
\r
	return 0;\r
}
`})})]})}function M(i={}){let{wrapper:n}=i.components||{};return n?(0,e.jsx)(n,Object.assign({},i,{children:(0,e.jsx)(s,i)})):s(i)}var g=M;function $(i,n,r){throw new Error("Expected "+(n?"component":"object")+" `"+i+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it."+(r?"\nIt\u2019s referenced in your code at `"+r+"` in `C:\\Users\\\uAC15\uB2E4\uD61C\\Desktop\\code\\psst54-blog-ts\\files\\post\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-4df297bb-a7a9-47e8-916a-a165b24e09d9.mdx`":""))}return w(b);})();
;return Component;

body.raw:
Next.js has two forms of pre-rendering: **Static Generation** and **Server-side Rendering**. The difference is in **when** it generates the HTML for a page.

- **Static Generation** is the pre-rendering method that generates the HTML at **build time**. The pre-rendered HTML is then _reused_ on each request.
- **Server-side Rendering** is the pre-rendering method that generates the HTML on **each request**.

Importantly, Next.js lets you **choose** which pre-rendering form to use for each page. You can create a "hybrid" Next.js app by using Static Generation for most pages and using Server-side Rendering for others.

body.raw:
Next.js has two forms of pre-rendering: **Static Generation** and **Server-side Rendering**. The difference is in **when** it generates the HTML for a page.

- **Static Generation** is the pre-rendering method that generates the HTML at **build time**. The pre-rendered HTML is then _reused_ on each request.
- **Server-side Rendering** is the pre-rendering method that generates the HTML on **each request**.

Importantly, Next.js lets you **choose** which pre-rendering form to use for each page. You can create a "hybrid" Next.js app by using Static Generation for most pages and using Server-side Rendering for others.

test

# head1

## head2

### head3

ppwewefeewfewefew

## Autolink literals

ppwewefeewfewefew

# content title

## Autolink literals

### head3

ppwewefeewfewefew

### head3

wefwefeweewe\
wefewfewfw

wefwe

## Autolink literals

ppwewefeewfewefew

www.example.com, https://example.com, and contact@example.com.

body.raw:
# content title

## Autolink literals

www.example.com, https://example.com, and contact@example.com.

## Footnote

A note[^1]

[^1]: Big note.

## Strikethrough

~one~ or ~~two~~ tildes.

## Table

| a   | b   |   c |  d  |
| --- | :-- | --: | :-: |

## Tasklist

- [ ] to do
- [x] done
